sn12.37:4.2: “Mendicants, this body doesn’t belong to you or to anyone else.
sn12.37:4.3: It’s old deeds, and should be seen as produced by choices and intentions, as something to be felt.
sn12.37:5.1: A learned noble disciple carefully focuses on sources in the case of dependent origination itself:
sn12.37:5.2: ‘When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
sn12.37:5.3: When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
sn12.37:5.5: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
sn12.37:5.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.37:5.7: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
sn12.37:5.9: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.’”
